name: BBC World Service
desc: International news, analysis and information from the BBC World Service. In-depth news and sport with audio, video and forums.

name: Classic FM
desc: Listen live to Classic FM online radio. Discover classical music and find out more about the best classical composers, musicians and their works.

name: New York Radio
desc: New York Radio Stations

name: Ancient Music
desc: Listeners wishing for a break from the modern world – with all its bleeps, blips and pushy commercials – should head over to this rather charming little radio station, which plays music from the Medieval and Renaissance periods and nothing else.

name: Hotmix Dance
desc: Hotmixradio Dance, écouter la radio gratuite, webradio, écouter musique house techno electro DJs agenda photos clubbing clips vidéos actus biographies,

name: 70s Disco Night
desc: This wonderfully old-school internet radio station, complete with spinning mirror–ball animation, is a great way to capture the essence of disco. Expect irresistibly catchy tunes, ridiculously upbeat lyrics and a faint sense of nostalgia for the era of flares and wide-collared shirts.

name: Old Time Radio
desc: Some time ago, I recommended the Antioch OTR station (radio.macinmind.com) as a fine source of soothing American radio programmes from the golden era of the 1920s-50s. This site goes one better by allowing users to listen to the shows on demand, with a generous archive.

name: RFI 24H en France
desc: écouter la session 27min, lundi à vendredi

name: RFI Dernier Journal Monde
desc: Suivez toute l"information politique, culturelle, sportive en direct et en continu sur RFI

name: RFI Dernier Journal en Francais Facile
desc: Suivez toute l"information politique, culturelle, sportive en direct et en continu sur RFI

name: The Classical Station
desc: WCPE, The Classical Station, plays Great Classical Music 24 hours a day on 89.7 FM in North Carolina

name: Piano Solo
desc: In spite of its cringeworthy name, this station is actually rather a classy operation, which provides an online outlet for the works of over two hundred talented but unsigned solo piano composers. The music tends towards meditative, classical-style compositions (think Ludovico Einaudi and George Winston in terms of tone), and makes for a gentle alternative to Classic FM.

name: Restro Soul
desc: Craig Charles’s show on 6 Music proves there’s a big appetite for old-fashioned funk and soul radio in the UK – and this great station from London is evidently capitalising on it. Featuring everyone from The Staple Singers to Chic to Skull Snaps to Luther Vandross, its playlist is an almost guaranteed mood-improver

name: KUVO Jazz
desc: Based in Denver, Colorado, its artfully-curated playlists mostly focus on jazz – broadcasting everything from Ella Fitzgerald through to Madeleine Peyroux. A class act.

name: GLT News
desc: Broadcasting from studios on the grounds of Illinois State University in the wonderfully-named town of Normal, WGLT is a creative independent radio station with a wide range of programming – from spoken word shows like Radiolab and This American Life to some excellent in-house blues and jazz.

name: NPR Hourly News
desc: NPR delivers breaking national and world news. Also top stories from business, politics, health, science, technology, music, arts and culture

name: GLT Jazz Radio
desc: Broadcasting from studios on the grounds of Illinois State University in the wonderfully-named town of Normal, WGLT is a creative independent radio station with a wide range of programming – from spoken word shows like Radiolab and This American Life to some excellent in-house blues and jazz.

name: GLT Acousticity
desc: Broadcasting from studios on the grounds of Illinois State University in the wonderfully-named town of Normal, WGLT is a creative independent radio station with a wide range of programming – from spoken word shows like Radiolab and This American Life to some excellent in-house blues and jazz.

name: KEXP
desc: Seattle has long been a key musical centre in the US – the birthplace of grunge music, home to Nirvana and Pearl Jam and more recently, Fleet Foxes. No surprise, then, that the city is also home to a world-class indie and alt-rock radio station. Think XFM, but about a hundred times cooler

name: Reach On Air
desc: This station gives aspiring broadcasters the chance to put their own content out to a global audience for free. Would–be DJs simply need to record their show, book a time–slot and upload it to the site. Much of the content is shaky, but it"s heartening to hear people giving the medium a shot

name: DFM RTV INT
desc: Based in central Amsterdam, this radio station broadcasts an eclectic mixture of music, talk and "found sound". I tuned in the other day to hear the audio from an episode of Adam Curtis’s BBC Two documentary series All Watched Over By Machines Of Loving Grace interspersed with Britpop era hits. Oddly captivating

name: WRUV FM
desc: This community-run station from the University of Vermont is a regular springer of surprises, thanks to its 'free form' policy. In a nutshell, DJs are given a weekly slot to play whatever they like. This can be a recipe for disaster in the wrong hands, but here it leads to an energising blend

name: WFMU
desc: Possibly the world"s coolest radio station, WFMU is the longest running independent 'freeform' station in the US, operating out of Mount Hope in New Jersey, paid for by its listeners (no ads!), with an eclectic slate of shows that offers something for anyone who has ever ventured outside the mainstream, from the French pop (and birdsong) inflections of This is the Modern World with Trouble to the early gospel of Sinner"s Crossroads.

name: The Beatles
desc: The Beatles - non stop
